attributes.comment:
Increasing the fees is just par for the USCIS. My husband has been trying to get
his green card for the last year and 8 months and all the agency will tell us is that
his case is in "processing". Really? It has been in processing for that long? You
see, USCIS doesn't want to change his status so we can keep paying the fees to
extend his work visa every year and driving 2 hours out of our way for 1(yes one)
fingerprint. USCIS does not care about the people they claim they are working to
help. Seriously, have you ever gotten a nice person on the phone when you have
called the 800 number to ask a simple question? I haven't, and everyone that I
have talked to can barely speak English! I bet they got their papers fast. My point
is, is increasing the fees really going to help, especially if you have been waiting
for so long anyway? And have had to deal with people who are extremely rude,
inconsiderate and it's like an act of congress to get the agency to send you a
response in the mail. (my husband and I still have not heard from them and it has
been over 3 months) Can the agency really guarantee that we will have faster turn-
around times, better customer service and fewer backlogs? I doubt it. People think
about it, the government is trying to issue an additional 40,000 H1B visas. Who do
you think is going to process all these applications? The USCIS of course! In
reality, we are going to be paying higher fees so they can process an additional
40,000 visas. That means anyone in the system right now is going to just sit there
even longer. Thanks USCIS!
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Stacy Tatiersky
